April 4, Google announced in an earnings release that the New York Times reported easily beat Wall Street's expectations. Google announced that Eric Schmidt will serve as executive chairman, advising Page and Google co-founder Sergey Brin and concentrating on deals, partnerships, customers, and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership. In a short piece for Harvard Business Review, Eric Schmidt said Google's strategic initiatives are "all about mobile."
